snippet: After the defense minister was dismissed on Tuesday, members of his Free Democrats Party abandoned the governing coalition, potentially slowing the country’s integration with the West.
abstract: Pro-Western political party Free Democrats abandons Georgia’s governing coalition, deepening a political crisis in the former Soviet republic that critics fear may slow the country’s path toward integration with the West.
lead_paragraph: After the defense minister was dismissed on Tuesday, members of his Free Democrats Party abandoned the governing coalition, potentially slowing the country’s integration with the West.

headline.main: Political Feud Weakens Coalition in Georgia
headline.print_headline: Political Feud Weakens Coalition in Georgia
